p: A comparison of the performance of standard, whole-genome shotgun DNA sequence assemblers in viral metagenomes has been published recently (Vázquez-Castellanos et al., 2014). None of the tested assemblers achieved convincing results. Whole-genome assemblers are known to perform poorly on metagenomes because they assume even coverage (Pop, 2009; Laserson et al., 2011; Peng et al., 2011; Lai et al., 2012; Namiki et al., 2012; Scholz et al., 2012). An assembler that was designed to work with uneven depth encountered in metagenomes is IDBA-UD (Peng et al., 2011) and it has been tested for viral genome assembly in simulated viral metagenomes with good results (Aguirre de Cárcer et al., 2014).
